Md. Shamsul Islam (born. October 9, 1958) is a Bangladeshi tax consultant who, along with Md. Rashidul Hasan, previously served as one of the two vice-presidents of the Dhaka Taxes Bar Association for the session year 2015-2016 under President Alhaj Mazam Ali Khan of the same Taxes Bar Association, during the dictatorship of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina of President Mohammad Abdul Hamid of Bangladesh. Shamsul Islam served as the vice-president of the Dhaka Taxes Bar Association under the ticket of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party at a time when almost all part of the nation's bureaucracy was heavily dominated by Sheikh Hasina's Bangladesh Awami League.
Early Life and Education
Md. Shamsul Islam was born on October 9, 1958 in his maternal ancestral village of Barrah (বাহ্রা) within the Nawabganj area of Dhaka District in the erstwhile eastern wing of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan during the presidency of Iskandar Ali Mirza. He was the third child and eldest son among Shamsul Alam and Rahima Khanom's five children. His father worked for the Government Printing Press and his mother was a homemaker. Md. Shamsul Islam had his early education in Government Laboratory High School; a few years after Pakistan’s eastern wing seceded to become the new state of the People's Republic of Bangladesh, Islam earned his Secondary School and Higher Secondary Certificates in 1973 and 1975 respectively from the Laboratory High School.
During the presidency of Ziaur Rahman, Shamsul Islam achieved his Bachelor of Commerce degree from Dhaka College in 1977. Later in 1979, he earned his Master of Commerce degree from Jagannath College (which was affiliated with the University of Dhaka at that time but later became an independent university on its own right in 2005).
Career
After completing his post-graduate education, Md. Shamsul Islam joined the Dhaka Taxes Bar Association as a tax consultant in 1981. During the military dictatorship of Lt. General Hussain Muhammad Ershad, Shamsul Islam served as a committee member of ward no. 48 of the Dhaka City Corporation (now ward no. 14 of Dhaka South City Corporation) under Ward Commissioner Amzad Hossain Miah of the Jatiya Party. Later, during the premiership of Begum Khaleda Zia, Md. Shamsul Islam also briefly served as the vice-president of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party’s Hazaribagh Thana branch.
During the dictatorship of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, Alhaj Mazam Ali Khan was elected as President of the Dhaka Taxes Bar Association for the session year 2015-2016 under the ticket of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party. Md. Shamsul Islam and Md. Rashidul Hasan were made vice-presidents under Mazam Ali Khan.
Personal Life
Md. Shamsul Islam married Shahana Khanam, a daughter of Late Haji Momotaz Uddin Khan who was the owner of several business enterprises including the Rahmania Coir Foam Industries and Shoformali River Transportation Ltd. With Shahana Khanam, Islam has two children: a daughter, Fayequa Shams and a son, Shams Al Farabi. After Mrs. Shahana Islam passed away in 2002, Shamsul Islam married Ashrafi Khanam in 2003. Islam is also a first cousin-once-removed of the English dancer and choreographer Akram Khan; Islam's paternal aunt was the grandmother of Akram Khan.
In January 2024, at the age of 65, Md. Shamsul Islam was diagnosed with colorectal cancer and was going through treatment at Sri Ramachandra Medical Centre in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India and Dhaka Cancer and General Hospital of Dhaka city throughout 2024. After going through radiation therapy, a colostomy bag installation and several chemotherapy cycles, Islam made speedy recovery from the cancer in December 2024 when his colostomy bag was removed and he was able to go back to a normal lifestyle. He now goes through routine post-cancer treatment checkups from time to time in Chennai in order to avoid any recurrences of the cancer.
